unnormalised: The govt. is planning to seriously boost cruise tourism along the Indian coastline, bhai! Think Goa, Kerala, even the Andamans – imagine hopping between them on a fancy ship. The Ministry of Ports, Shipping and Waterways is looking at investing Rs. 4000 crores to develop infrastructure. That includes new terminals and upgrading existing ones.

unnormalised: Basically, they want to make it easier for big international cruise liners to dock. More tourists = more money for local economies, right? Plus, they're also pushing for domestic cruises. Imagine a relaxing trip from Mumbai to Kochi in a week!
